page.title: 12Chamber Farm - Water
page.content: The farm milk is collected by Milk Marketing Board tanker each day. At no time is the milk in contact with human hands. The feed is cattle provend from a 5 ton silo in the hayloft. At right angles to the barn is a new shed, the winter holding quarters, which will keep all the cows safe during bad weather. The floor slopes at one end to aid mucking out,which uses large scrapers. A huge trough holds enough silage for 2 to 3 days at a time. There is an attached small building between this and the dairy for calves. All bulls born are sold at market along with the weaker cows, only the stronger calves replace older cows and keep the herd at its usual level. Other barns and sheds hold the farm machinery which includes 4 tractors and other implements.
